alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 8:59PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado and northwestern Cheyenne Counties in northwestern Kansas through 830 PM MDT/930 PM CDT/... At 759 PM MDT/859 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Haigler, or 14 miles west of St. Francis, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado and northwestern Cheyenne Counties in northwestern Kansas, including the following locations... Beecher Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
